  • Gluten free

    Sept. 2nd, 2017

    Hereâ€™s the problem, gluten comes from wheat. Wheat is high in the kind of short chain sugars that really set IBS insides spinning. The accepted current opinion is that these kinds of short-chain sugars (such as fructose) are not absorbed efficiently in sufferers of IBS. So glutenous products tends to be off limits. The common mis-conception is that gluten is not Fodmap friendly, but this is actually not really the case.
